  69class DFT:
  70    """
  71    A class for performing Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations 
  72    with optional support for density fitting (DF), GPU acceleration, and LibXC.
  73
  74    Parameters
  75    ----------
  76    mol : Molecule
  77        Molecular object on which the DFT calculation is to be performed.
  78    
  79    basis : Basis
  80        Orbital basis set used for the SCF calculation.
  81
  82    auxbasis : Basis, optional
  83        Auxiliary basis set for density fitting (DF). If None, a default will be assigned.
  84
  85    conv_crit : float, optional
  86        Convergence criterion for the SCF cycle in Hartrees (default is 1e-7).
  87
  88    dmat_guess_method : str, optional
  89        Method for the initial density matrix guess (e.g., 'core', 'huckel').
  90
  91    xc : list or str, optional
  92        Exchange-correlation functional specification. If None, defaults to LDA (`[1, 7]`).
  93
  94    grids : object, optional
  95        Precomputed numerical integration grids. If None, they will be generated automatically.
  96
  97    gridsLevel : int, optional
  98        Level of numerical integration grid refinement (default is 3).
  99
 100    blocksize : int, optional
 101        Block size for XC grid evaluations. Defaults depend on whether GPU is used.
 102
 103    save_ao_values : bool, optional
 104        If True, saves AO values to reuse during XC evaluation. Increases speed but uses more memory.
 105
 106    use_gpu : bool, optional
 107        Whether to use GPU acceleration.
 108
 109    ncores : int, optional
 110        Number of CPU cores to use (default is 2).
 111
 112    Attributes
 113    ----------
 114    dmat : ndarray
 115        Initial guess for the density matrix, will be computed during setup.
 116
 117    KSmats : list
 118        List of Kohn–Sham matrices used in DIIS extrapolation.
 119
 120    errVecs : list
 121        List of error vectors for DIIS.
 122
 123    max_itr : int
 124        Maximum number of SCF iterations (default is 50).
 125
 126    isDF : bool
 127        Whether to use density fitting for Coulomb integrals.
 128
 129    rys : bool
 130        Whether to use Rys quadrature for evaluating electron repulsion integrals.
 131
 132    DF_algo : int
 133        Algorithm selector for DF (reserved for developer use).
 134
 135    XC_algo : int
 136        Algorithm selector for XC evaluation (2 for CPU, 3 for GPU).
 137
 138    sortGrids : bool
 139        Whether to sort DFT integration grids (not recommended).
 140
 141    xc_bf_screen : bool
 142        Enable basis function screening for XC term evaluation.
 143
 144    threshold_schwarz : float
 145        Threshold for Schwarz screening (default is 1e-9).
 146
 147    strict_schwarz : bool
 148        If True, applies stricter Schwarz screening.
 149
 150    cholesky : bool
 151        If True, uses Cholesky decomposition for DF.
 152
 153    orthogonalize : bool
 154        If True, orthogonalizes AO basis functions.
 155
 156    sao : bool
 157        If True, uses SAO basis instead of CAO basis.
 158
 159    keep_ao_in_gpu : bool
 160        Whether to retain AO values in GPU memory during SCF (if `save_ao_values` is True).
 161
 162    use_libxc : bool
 163        Whether to use LibXC for XC functional evaluation (recommended off for GPU).
 164
 165    n_streams : int
 166        Number of CUDA streams to use (if applicable).
 167
 168    n_gpus : int
 169        Number of GPUs to use.
 170
 171    free_gpu_mem : bool
 172        Whether to forcibly free GPU memory after use.
 173
 174    max_threads_per_block : int
 175        Maximum threads per CUDA block supported by the device.
 176
 177    threads_x : int
 178        CUDA thread configuration (X dimension).
 179
 180    threads_y : int
 181        CUDA thread configuration (Y dimension).
 182
 183    dynamic_precision : bool
 184        Whether to use precision switching during XC evaluation for performance gains.
 185
 186    keep_ints3c2e_in_gpu : bool
 187        Whether to keep 3-center 2-electron integrals in GPU memory to avoid transfers.
 188
 189    debug : bool
 190        If True, prints debugging output during DFT calculations.
 191
 192    Notes
 193    -----
 194    - This class supports SCF DFT calculations with density fitting (DF).
 195    - GPU support is optional and provides significant speed-up for large systems.
 196    - The class is tightly integrated with PyFock and LibXC libraries.
 197
 198    Examples
 199    --------
 200    >>> mol = Molecule(...)
 201    >>> basis = Basis(mol, ...)
 202    >>> dft = DFT(mol, basis, xc='PBE', use_gpu=True)
 203    >>> dft.run_scf()
 204    """
 205    def __init__(self, mol, basis, auxbasis=None, conv_crit=1e-7, dmat_guess_method=None, 
 206                xc=None, grids=None, gridsLevel=3, blocksize=None, 
 207                save_ao_values=False, use_gpu=False, ncores=2): 
 208         
 209        self.mol = mol
 210        """ Molecular object for which the DFT calculation will be performed """
 211        if self.mol is None:
 212            print('ERROR: A Mol object is required to initialize a DFT object.')
 213        
 214        self.basis = basis
 215        """ Basis object for corresponding to the molecule for the DFT calculation """
 216        if self.basis is None:
 217            print('ERROR: A Basis object is required to initialize a DFT object.')
 218
 219        
 220        self.dmat_guess_method = dmat_guess_method
 221        """ Initial guess for the density matrix """
 222        if self.dmat_guess_method is None:
 223            self.dmat_guess_method = 'core'
 224
 225        self.dmat = None
 226        """ Initial density matrix guess for SCF """
 227        
 228        self.xc = xc
 229        """ Exchange-Correlation Functional """
 230        if self.xc is None: 
 231            self.xc = [1, 7] #LDA
 232            print("XC not specified, defaulting to LDA functional (LibXC codes: 1, 7)")
 233
 234        # DIIS
 235        self.KSmats = []
 236        self.errVecs = []
 237        self.diisSpace = 6
 238
 239        self.conv_crit = conv_crit
 240        """ Convergence criterion for SCF (in Hartrees) """
 241        # if self.conv_crit is None:
 242        #     self.conv_crit = 1.0E-7
 243
 244        self.max_itr = 50 
 245        """ Maximum number of iterations for SCF """
 246        # if self.max_itr is None:
 247        #     self.max_itr = 50
 248
 249        self.ncores = ncores
 250        """ Number of cores to be used for DFT calculation """
 251        if self.ncores is None:
 252            self.ncores = 2
 253
 254        self.grids = grids 
 255        """ Atomic grids for DFT calculation (If None or not supplied, will be generated using NumGrid) """
 256        self.gridsLevel = gridsLevel
 257        """ Atomic grids for DFT calculation """
 258
 259        self.isDF = True
 260        """ Use density fitting (DF) for two-electron Coulomb integrals. This is only for developers. Users should not change it. """
 261
 262        self.auxbasis = auxbasis
 263        """ Basis object to be used as the auxiliary basis for DF """
 264        if self.auxbasis is None:
 265            auxbasis = Basis(mol, {'all':Basis.load(mol=mol, basis_name='def2-universal-jfit')})
 266
 267        self.rys = True
 268        """ Use rys quadrature for the evaluation of two electron integrals (with and without DF)"""
 269
 270        self.DF_algo = 10
 271        """ This is only for developers. Users should not change it. """
 272
 273        self.blocksize = blocksize
 274        """ Block size for the evaulation of XC term on grids. For CPUs a value of ~5000 is recommended. For GPUs, a value >20480 is recommended. """
 275        if blocksize is None:
 276            if use_gpu:
 277                self.blocksize = 20480
 278            else:
 279                self.blocksize = 5000
 280        
 281        self.XC_algo = None
 282        """ This is only for developers. Users should not change it. The algorithm for XC evaluation should be 2 for CPU and 3 for GPU."""
 283        if use_gpu:
 284            self.XC_algo = 3
 285        else:
 286            self.XC_algo = 2 
 287
 288        self.debug = False
 289        """ Turn on printing debug statements """
 290        self.sortGrids = False
 291        """ Enable/Disable sorting of DFT grids. Doesn't seem to offer any signficant advantage."""
 292        self.save_ao_values = save_ao_values
 293        """ Whether to save atomic orbital (AO) values for reuse during XC evaluation. Improves performance but requires more memory. """
 294        self.xc_bf_screen = True
 295        """ Enable screening of basis functions for XC term evaluation to reduce computation time drastically. """
 296        self.threshold_schwarz = 1e-09
 297        """ Threshold for Schwarz screening of two-electron integrals. Smaller values increase accuracy but reduce sparsity. """
 298        self.strict_schwarz = True
 299        """ If True, enforce stricter Schwarz screening to aggressively eliminate small two-electron integrals. """
 300        self.cholesky = True
 301        """ Whether to use Cholesky decomposition for DF. Slightly speeds up calculations. """
 302        self.orthogonalize = True
 303        """ Apply orthogonalization to the AO basis. Should be True for most standard calculations. """
 304
 305
 306        # CAO or SAO
 307        self.sao = False
 308        """ Whether to use SAO basis or CAO basis. Default is CAO basis. """
 309
 310
 311        # GPU acceleration
 312        self.use_gpu = use_gpu
 313        """ Whether to use GPU acceleration or not """
 314        self.keep_ao_in_gpu = True
 315        """ Whether to keep the atomic orbitals for XC evaluation in GPU memory or CPU memory. Only relevant if save_ao_values = True. """
 316        self.use_libxc = True
 317        """ Whether to use LibXC's version of XC functionals or PyFock implementations. 
 318        Only relevant when GPU is used. For GPU calculations it is recommended to use PyFock 
 319        implementation as it avoids CPU-GPU transfers."""
 320        self.n_streams = 1
 321        self.n_gpus = 1
 322        """ Number of GPUs to be used """
 323        self.free_gpu_mem = False
 324        """ Whether the GPU memory should be freed by force or not"""
 325        try:
 326            self.max_threads_per_block = cuda.get_current_device().MAX_THREADS_PER_BLOCK
 327        except:
 328            self.max_threads_per_block = 1024
 329        
 330        self.threads_x = int(self.max_threads_per_block/16)
 331        self.threads_y = int(self.max_threads_per_block/64)
 332        self.dynamic_precision = False # Only for the XC term
 333        """ Whether to use dynamic precision switching for XC term or not """
 334        self.keep_ints3c2e_in_gpu = True
 335        """ Whether to keep the 3c2e integrals in GPU memory or not. 
 336        Recommended to keep in GPU memory to avoid CPU-GPU transfers at each iteration."""
 337        
 338        # self.max_threads_per_block = 1024
 339        # self.threads_x = 64
 340        # self.threads_y = 16
 341
 342        # if self.use_gpu:
 343        #     try:
 344        #         global cp
 345        #         global cupy_scipy
 346        #         import cupy as cp
 347        #         import cupyx.scipy as cupy_scipy
 348        #         # from cupy.linalg import eig, multi_dot as dot
 349        #     except ModuleNotFoundError:
 350        #         print('Cupy was not found!')

 355    def nuclear_rep_energy(self, mol=None):
 356        """
 357        Compute the nuclear-nuclear repulsion energy.
 358
 359        Parameters
 360        ----------
 361        mol : Molecule, optional
 362            Molecule object containing nuclear coordinates and charges. 
 363            If None, uses `self.mol`.
 364
 365        Returns
 366        -------
 367        float
 368            The nuclear repulsion energy in Hartrees.
 369        """
 370        # Nuclear-nuclear energy
 371        if mol is None: 
 372            mol = self.mol
 373    
 374        e = 0
 375        for i in range(mol.natoms):
 376            for j in range(i, mol.natoms):
 377                if (i!=j):
 378                    dist = mol.coordsBohrs[i]-mol.coordsBohrs[j]
 379                    e = e + mol.Zcharges[i]*mol.Zcharges[j]/np.sqrt(np.sum(dist**2))
 380
 381        return e
 382        
 383    # full density matrix for RKS/RHF
 384    def gen_dm(self, mo_coeff, mo_occ):
 385        """
 386        Generate the density matrix from molecular orbital coefficients and occupations.
 387
 388        Parameters
 389        ----------
 390        mo_coeff : ndarray
 391            Molecular orbital coefficient matrix.
 392
 393        mo_occ : ndarray
 394            Array of MO occupation numbers.
 395
 396        Returns
 397        -------
 398        ndarray
 399            Density matrix (RHF/RKS type).
 400        """
 401        mocc = mo_coeff[:,mo_occ>0]
 402   
 403        return np.dot(mocc*mo_occ[mo_occ>0], mocc.conj().T)
 404    
 405    def getOcc(self, mol=None, energy_mo=None, coeff_mo=None):
 406        """
 407        Assign occupation numbers to molecular orbitals based on their energies.
 408
 409        Parameters
 410        ----------
 411        mol : Molecule
 412            Molecule object to extract the number of electrons.
 413
 414        energy_mo : ndarray
 415            Array of MO energies.
 416
 417        coeff_mo : ndarray
 418            Array of MO coefficients (not used but kept for compatibility).
 419
 420        Returns
 421        -------
 422        ndarray
 423            Array of MO occupations (0 or 2 for RHF).
 424        """
 425        e_idx = np.argsort(energy_mo)
 426        e_sort = energy_mo[e_idx]
 427        nmo = energy_mo.size
 428        occ_mo = np.zeros(nmo)
 429        nocc = mol.nelectrons // 2
 430        occ_mo[e_idx[:nocc]] = 2
 431        return occ_mo
 432    
 433    def gen_dm_cupy(self, mo_coeff, mo_occ):
 434        """
 435        Generate the density matrix using CuPy for GPU acceleration.
 436
 437        Parameters
 438        ----------
 439        mo_coeff : cp.ndarray
 440            Molecular orbital coefficient matrix (on GPU).
 441
 442        mo_occ : cp.ndarray
 443            Array of MO occupation numbers (on GPU).
 444
 445        Returns
 446        -------
 447        cp.ndarray
 448            Density matrix (RHF/RKS type) computed on the GPU.
 449        """
 450        mocc = mo_coeff[:,mo_occ>0]
 451        return cp.dot(mocc*mo_occ[mo_occ>0], mocc.conj().T)
 452    
 453    def getOcc_cupy(self, mol=None, energy_mo=None, coeff_mo=None):
 454        """
 455        Assign occupation numbers to MOs using CuPy (for GPU-based calculations).
 456
 457        Parameters
 458        ----------
 459        mol : Molecule
 460            Molecule object to determine number of electrons.
 461
 462        energy_mo : cp.ndarray
 463            MO energy array on the GPU.
 464
 465        coeff_mo : cp.ndarray
 466            MO coefficients array on the GPU (not used).
 467
 468        Returns
 469        -------
 470        cp.ndarray
 471            Array of MO occupations (on GPU).
 472        """
 473        e_idx = cp.argsort(energy_mo)
 474        e_sort = energy_mo[e_idx]
 475        nmo = energy_mo.size
 476        occ_mo = cp.zeros(nmo)
 477        nocc = mol.nelectrons // 2
 478        occ_mo[e_idx[:nocc]] = 2
 479        return occ_mo
 480    
 481    def solve(self, H, S, orthogonalize=False, x=None):
 482        """
 483        Solve the generalized or canonical eigenvalue equation.
 484
 485        Parameters
 486        ----------
 487        H : ndarray
 488            Hamiltonian matrix.
 489
 490        S : ndarray
 491            Overlap matrix.
 492
 493        orthogonalize : bool, optional
 494            If True, solve using orthogonalized basis.
 495
 496        x : ndarray, optional
 497            Transformation matrix (if already computed).
 498
 499        Returns
 500        -------
 501        tuple of (ndarray, ndarray)
 502            Eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the system.
 503        """
 504        if not orthogonalize:
 505            #Solve the generalized eigenvalue equation HC = SCE
 506            eigvalues, eigvectors = scipy.linalg.eigh(H, S)
 507            
 508        else:
 509            if x is None:
 510                eig_val_s, eig_vec_s = scipy.linalg.eigh(S)
 511                # Removing the eigenvectors assoicated to the smallest eigenvalue.
 512                x = eig_vec_s[:,eig_val_s>1e-7] / np.sqrt(eig_val_s[eig_val_s>1e-7])
 513            xHx = x.T @ H @ x
 514            #Solve the canonical eigenvalue equation HC = CE
 515            eigvalues, eigvectors = scipy.linalg.eigh(xHx)
 516            eigvectors = np.dot(x, eigvectors)
 517
 518        idx = np.argmax(np.abs(eigvectors.real), axis=0)
 519        eigvectors[:,eigvectors[idx,np.arange(len(eigvalues))].real<0] *= -1
 520        return eigvalues, eigvectors # E, C
 521    
 522    def solve_cupy(self, H, S, orthogonalize=True):
 523        """
 524        Solve the generalized eigenvalue problem using CuPy (GPU).
 525
 526        Parameters
 527        ----------
 528        H : cp.ndarray
 529            Hamiltonian matrix (on GPU).
 530
 531        S : cp.ndarray
 532            Overlap matrix (on GPU).
 533
 534        orthogonalize : bool, optional
 535            If True, solve using orthogonalized basis.
 536
 537        Returns
 538        -------
 539        tuple of (cp.ndarray, cp.ndarray)
 540            Eigenvalues and eigenvectors (on GPU).
 541        """
 542        eig_val_s, eig_vec_s = cp.linalg.eigh(S)
 543        # Removing the eigenvectors assoicated to the smallest eigenvalue.
 544        x = eig_vec_s[:,eig_val_s>1e-7] / cp.sqrt(eig_val_s[eig_val_s>1e-7])
 545        xhx = x.T @ H @ x
 546        #Solve the canonical eigenvalue equation HC = SCE
 547        eigvalues, eigvectors = cp.linalg.eigh(xhx)
 548        eigvectors = cp.dot(x, eigvectors)
 549
 550        idx = cp.argmax(cp.abs(eigvectors.real), axis=0)
 551        eigvectors[:,eigvectors[idx,cp.arange(len(eigvalues))].real<0] *= -1
 552        return eigvalues, eigvectors # E, C
 553    
 554
 555    def getCoreH(self, mol=None, basis=None):
 556        """
 557        Compute the core Hamiltonian matrix (T + V).
 558
 559        Parameters
 560        ----------
 561        mol : Molecule, optional
 562            Molecule object.
 563
 564        basis : Basis, optional
 565            Basis set object.
 566
 567        Returns
 568        -------
 569        ndarray
 570            Core Hamiltonian matrix.
 571        """
 572        #Get the core Hamiltonian
 573        if mol is None:
 574            mol = self.mol
 575        if basis is None:
 576            basis = self.basis
 577        nao = basis.bfs_nao 
 578        H = np.empty((nao,nao))
 579        Vmat = Integrals.nuc_mat_symm(basis, mol)
 580        Tmat = Integrals.kin_mat_symm(basis)
 581        H = Vmat + Tmat
 582
 583        return H
 584
 585
 586    def guessCoreH(self, mol=None, basis=None, Hcore=None, S=None):
 587        """
 588        Generate a guess density matrix using the core Hamiltonian.
 589
 590        Parameters
 591        ----------
 592        mol : Molecule, optional
 593            Molecule object.
 594
 595        basis : Basis, optional
 596            Basis set.
 597
 598        Hcore : ndarray, optional
 599            Core Hamiltonian. If None, it will be computed.
 600
 601        S : ndarray, optional
 602            Overlap matrix. If None, it will be computed.
 603
 604        Returns
 605        -------
 606        ndarray
 607            Initial guess density matrix.
 608        """
 609        #Get a guess for the density matrix using the core Hamiltonian
 610        if mol is None:
 611            mol = self.mol
 612        if basis is None:
 613            basis = self.basis
 614        if Hcore is None:
 615            Hcore = self.getCoreH(mol, basis)
 616        if S is None:
 617            S = Integrals.overlap_mat_symm(basis)
 618
 619        eigvalues, eigvectors = scipy.linalg.eigh(Hcore, S)
 620        # print(eigvalues)
 621        idx = np.argmax(abs(eigvectors.real), axis=0)
 622        eigvectors[:,eigvectors[idx,np.arange(len(eigvalues))].real<0] *= -1
 623        mo_occ = self.getOcc(mol, eigvalues, eigvectors)
 624        # print(mo_occ)
 625        dmat = self.gen_dm(eigvectors, mo_occ)
 626
 627        return dmat
 628    
 629
 630    def DIIS(self,S,D,F):
 631        """
 632        Perform Direct Inversion in the Iterative Subspace (DIIS) to improve SCF convergence.
 633
 634        Adapted from
 635        ----------
 636        McMurchie-Davidson project:
 637        https://github.com/jjgoings/McMurchie-Davidson
 638        Licensed under the BSD-3-Clause license
 639
 640        Parameters
 641        ----------
 642        S : ndarray
 643            Overlap matrix.
 644
 645        D : ndarray
 646            Density matrix.
 647
 648        F : ndarray
 649            Fock matrix.
 650
 651        Returns
 652        -------
 653        ndarray
 654            DIIS-extrapolated Fock matrix.
 655        """
 656        FDS =   dot([F,D,S])
 657        # SDF =   np.conjugate(FDS).T 
 658        errVec = FDS - np.conjugate(FDS).T 
 659        self.KSmats.append(F)
 660        self.errVecs.append(errVec) 
 661        nKS = len(self.KSmats)
 662        if nKS > self.diisSpace:
 663            self.KSmats.pop(0) 
 664            self.errVecs.pop(0)
 665            nKS = nKS - 1
 666        B = np.zeros((nKS + 1,nKS + 1)) 
 667        B[-1,:] = B[:,-1] = -1.0
 668        B[-1,-1] = 0.0
 669        # B is symmetric
 670        for i in range(nKS):
 671            for j in range(i+1):
 672                B[i,j] = B[j,i] = \
 673                    np.real(np.trace(np.dot(np.conjugate(self.errVecs[i]).T, self.errVecs[j])))
 674        # for i in range(nKS):
 675        #     for j in range(i+1):
 676        #         print(self.errVecs[i].shape)
 677        #         B[i,j] = np.real(np.dot(np.conjugate(self.errVecs[i]).T, self.errVecs[j]))
 678        #         B[j,i] = B[i,j]
 679                                                    
 680        residual = np.zeros((nKS + 1, 1))
 681        residual[-1] = -1.0
 682        weights = scipy.linalg.solve(B,residual)
 683
 684        # weights is 1 x numFock + 1, but first numFock values
 685        # should sum to one if we are doing DIIS correctly
 686        assert np.isclose(sum(weights[:-1]),1.0)
 687
 688        F = np.zeros(F.shape)
 689        for i, KS in enumerate(self.KSmats):
 690            weight = weights[i]
 691            F += numexpr.evaluate('(weight * KS)')
 692
 693        return F 
 694    
 695    def DIIS_cupy(self,S,D,F):
 696        """
 697        Perform DIIS on GPU using CuPy to accelerate SCF convergence.
 698
 699        Adapted from
 700        ----------
 701        McMurchie-Davidson project:
 702        https://github.com/jjgoings/McMurchie-Davidson
 703        Licensed under the BSD-3-Clause license
 704
 705        Parameters
 706        ----------
 707        S : cp.ndarray
 708            Overlap matrix (on GPU).
 709
 710        D : cp.ndarray
 711            Density matrix (on GPU).
 712
 713        F : cp.ndarray
 714            Fock matrix (on GPU).
 715
 716        Returns
 717        -------
 718        cp.ndarray
 719            DIIS-extrapolated Fock matrix (on GPU).
 720        """
 721        FDS =   F @ D @ S
 722        errVec = FDS - cp.conjugate(FDS).T 
 723        self.KSmats.append(F)
 724        self.errVecs.append(errVec) 
 725        nKS = len(self.KSmats)
 726        if nKS > self.diisSpace:
 727            self.KSmats.pop(0) 
 728            self.errVecs.pop(0)
 729            nKS = nKS - 1
 730        B = cp.zeros((nKS + 1,nKS + 1)) 
 731        B[-1,:] = B[:,-1] = -1.0
 732        B[-1,-1] = 0.0
 733        # B is symmetric
 734        for i in range(nKS):
 735            for j in range(i+1):
 736                B[i,j] = B[j,i] = \
 737                    cp.real(cp.trace(cp.dot(cp.conjugate(self.errVecs[i]).T, self.errVecs[j])))
 738                                                    
 739        residual = cp.zeros((nKS + 1, 1))
 740        residual[-1] = -1.0
 741        weights = cp.linalg.solve(B,residual)
 742
 743        # weights is 1 x numFock + 1, but first numFock values
 744        # should sum to one if we are doing DIIS correctly
 745        assert cp.isclose(sum(weights[:-1]),1.0)
 746
 747        F = cp.zeros(F.shape)
 748        for i, KS in enumerate(self.KSmats):
 749            weight = weights[i]
 750            F += weight * KS
 751
 752        return F 
 753
 754    # @profile
 755    def scf(self):
 756        """
 757        Perform Self-Consistent Field (SCF) calculation for Density Functional Theory (DFT).
 758        
 759        This method implements a complete DFT SCF procedure including:
 760        - One-electron integral calculation (overlap, kinetic, nuclear attraction)
 761        - Two-electron integral calculation (4-center ERIs or density fitting)
 762        - Grid generation and pruning for exchange-correlation evaluation
 763        - Iterative SCF cycles with DIIS convergence acceleration
 764        - Exchange-correlation energy and potential evaluation using LibXC
 765        - GPU acceleration support for performance-critical operations
 766        
 767        The implementation supports multiple algorithmic variants:
 768        - Density fitting (DF)
 769        - Schwarz screening for integral sparsity
 770        - Multiple XC evaluation algorithms (CPU/GPU optimized)
 771        - Dynamic precision switching for GPU calculations
 772        
 773        SCF Procedure:
 774        1. Initialize one-electron integrals (S, T, V_nuc)
 775        2. Calculate/prepare two-electron integrals with optional screening
 776        3. Generate and prune integration grids for XC evaluation
 777        4. Iterative SCF loop:
 778        - Build Coulomb matrix J from density matrix
 779        - Evaluate exchange-correlation energy/potential on grids
 780        - Form Kohn-Sham matrix: H_KS = H_core + J + V_xc
 781        - Apply DIIS convergence acceleration
 782        - Diagonalize KS matrix to get new orbitals
 783        - Generate new density matrix from occupied orbitals
 784        - Check energy convergence
 785        5. Return converged total energy and density matrix
 786        
 787        Computational Features:
 788        - Multi-threading support via Numba and configurable core count
 789        - GPU acceleration using CuPy for grid-based operations
 790        - Memory-efficient batched evaluation of XC terms
 791        - Multiple density fitting algorithms (DF_algo 1-10)
 792        - Basis function screening for XC evaluation efficiency
 793        - Optional Cholesky decomposition for 2-center integrals
 794        
 795        Returns:
 796        --------
 797        tuple[float, numpy.ndarray]
 798            Etot : float
 799                Converged total electronic energy in atomic units
 800            dmat : numpy.ndarray, shape (nbf, nbf)
 801                Converged density matrix in atomic orbital basis
 802                
 803        Raises:
 804        -------
 805        ConvergenceError
 806            If SCF fails to converge within max_itr iterations
 807            
 808        Notes:
 809        ------
 810        - Uses class attributes for all computational parameters (basis, xc, conv_crit, etc.)
 811        - Extensive timing and profiling information printed during execution
 812        - Memory usage information displayed for large arrays
 813        - GPU memory automatically freed after completion
 814        - Supports both Cartesian (CAO) and Spherical (SAO) atomic orbital bases
 815        
 816        The function performs comprehensive error checking and provides detailed
 817        timing breakdowns for performance analysis. GPU acceleration is automatically
 818        enabled when CuPy is available and use_gpu=True.
 819        
 820        Example Energy Components:
 821        - Electron-nuclear attraction energy
 822        - Nuclear repulsion energy  
 823        - Kinetic energy
 824        - Coulomb (electron-electron repulsion) energy
 825        - Exchange-correlation energy
 826        """
 827        #### Timings
 828        duration1e = 0
 829        durationDIIS = 0
 830        durationAO_values = 0
 831        durationCoulomb = 0
 832        durationgrids = 0
 833        durationItr = 0
 834        durationxc = 0
 835        durationXCpreprocessing = 0
 836        durationDF = 0
 837        durationKS = 0
 838        durationSCF = 0
 839        durationgrids_prune_rho = 0
 840        durationSchwarz = 0
 841        duration2c2e = 0
 842        durationDF_coeff = 0
 843        durationDF_gamma = 0
 844        durationDF_Jtri = 0
 845        durationDF_cholesky = 0
 846        startSCF = timer()    
 847
 848        mol = self.mol
 849        basis = self.basis
 850        dmat = self.dmat
 851        xc = self.xc
 852        conv_crit = self.conv_crit
 853        max_itr = self.max_itr
 854        ncores = self.ncores
 855        grids = self.grids
 856        gridsLevel = self.gridsLevel
 857        isDF = self.isDF
 858        auxbasis = self.auxbasis
 859        rys = self.rys
 860        DF_algo = self.DF_algo
 861        blocksize = self.blocksize
 862        XC_algo = self.XC_algo
 863        debug = self.debug
 864        sortGrids = self.sortGrids
 865        save_ao_values = self.save_ao_values
 866        xc_bf_screen = self.xc_bf_screen
 867        threshold_schwarz = self.threshold_schwarz
 868        strict_schwarz = self.strict_schwarz
 869        cholesky = self.cholesky
 870        orthogonalize = self.orthogonalize
 871
 872        print_pyfock_logo()
 873        print('\n\nNumber of atoms:', mol.natoms)
 874        print('\n\nNumber of basis functions (atomic orbitals):', basis.bfs_nao)
 875        print('\n\nNumber of auxiliary basis functions:', auxbasis.bfs_nao)
 876        print('\n\n================================================================================\n\n')
 877
 878        print_sys_info()
 879
 880        #### Set number of cores
 881        numba.set_num_threads(ncores)
 882        os.environ['RAYON_NUM_THREADS'] = str(ncores)
 883        
 884        print('Running DFT using '+str(numba.get_num_threads())+' threads for Numba.\n\n', flush=True)
 885        # if basis is None:
 886        #     basis = self.basis
 887        # if mol is None:
 888        #     mol = self.mol
 889        # if xc is None:
 890        #     xc = self.xc
 891        # if gridsLevel is None:
 892        #     gridsLevel = self.gridsLevel
 893        # if auxbasis is None:
 894        #     auxbasis = Basis(mol, {'all':Basis.load(mol=mol, basis_name='def2-universal-jfit')})
 895        if grids is None:
 896            sortGrids = True
 897        if xc_bf_screen==False:
 898            if save_ao_values==True:
 899                print('Warning! AO screening is set to False, but AO values are requested to be saved. \
 900                      AO values can only be saved when XC_BF_SCREEN=TRUE. AO values will not be saved.', flush=True)
 901                save_ao_values = False
 902        if CUPY_AVAILABLE:
 903            if self.use_gpu:
 904                print('GPU acceleration is enabled. Currently this only accelerates AO values and XC term evaluation.', flush=True)
 905                print('GPU(s) information:')
 906                # print(cp.cuda.Device.mem_info())
 907                print(cuda.detect())
 908                print('Max threads per block supported by the GPU: ', cuda.get_current_device().MAX_THREADS_PER_BLOCK, flush=True)
 909                print('The user has specified to use '+str(self.n_gpus)+' GPU(s).')
 910            
 911                # For CUDA computations
 912                threads_per_block = (self.threads_x, self.threads_y)
 913                print('Threads per block configuration for the XC term: ', threads_per_block, flush=True)
 914                print('Threads per block configuration for the all other calculations: ', (32, 32), flush=True)
 915                if self.dynamic_precision:
 916                    print('\n\nWill use dynamic precision. ')
 917                    print('This means that the XC term will be evaluated in single precision until the ')
 918                    print('relative energy difference b/w successive iterations is less than 5.0E-7.')
 919                    precision_XC = cp.float32
 920                else:
 921                    precision_XC = cp.float64
 922
 923                if XC_algo is None:
 924                    XC_algo = 3
 925                if blocksize is None:
 926                    blocksize = 20480
 927                streams = []
 928                nb_streams = []
 929                for i in range(self.n_gpus):
 930                    cp.cuda.Device(i).use()
 931                    cp_stream = cp.cuda.Stream(non_blocking = True)
 932                    nb_stream = cuda.external_stream(cp_stream.ptr)
 933                    streams.append(cp_stream)
 934                    nb_streams.append(nb_stream)
 935                # Switch back to main GPU
 936                cp.cuda.Device(0).use()
 937                streams[0].use()
 938                # # Set some basis function data as cupy arrays to avoid redoing it during XC term evaluation at every SCF iteration
 939                # bfs_coords = cp.asarray([basis.bfs_coords], dtype=precision_XC)

 943                # #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
 944                # #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
 945                # #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
 946                # #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
 947                # #it can accomadate all the lists.
 948                # maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
 949                # bfs_coeffs = cp.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim], dtype=precision_XC)
 950                # bfs_expnts = cp.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim], dtype=precision_XC)
 951                # bfs_prim_norms = cp.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim], dtype=precision_XC)
 952                # bfs_radius_cutoff = cp.zeros([basis.bfs_nao], dtype=precision_XC)

 954                #     for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):

 995        # DF_algo = 1 # Worst algorithm for more than 500 bfs/auxbfs (requires 2x mem of 3c2e integrals and a large prefactor)
 996        # DF_algo = 2 # Sligthly better (2x memory efficient) algorithm than above (requires 1x mem of 3c2e integrals and a large prefactor)

1004        # DF_algo = 9 #

1007            start1e = timer()

1027        else:
1028            start1e = timer()
1029            print('\nCalculating overlap and kinetic integrals...\n\n', flush=True)
1030            # One electron integrals
1031            if not self.use_gpu:
1032                S = Integrals.overlap_mat_symm(basis)

1063                # Later the dmat will be converted back to SAO after J and XC term evaluations
1064        if not isDF: # 4c2e ERI case
1065

1075            else:

1077                # threshold_schwarz = 1e-09
1078                print('Threshold ', threshold_schwarz)
1079                startSchwarz = timer()
1080                nints4c2e_sym8 = int(basis.bfs_nao**4/8)
1081                nints4c2e = int(basis.bfs_nao**4)

1098                # indices_temp = []
1099                ijkl = [0, 0, 0, 0]
1100                if chunksize<nints4c2e_sym8:
1101                    nchunks = nints4c2e_sym8//chunksize + 1
1102                else:

1107                    
1108                    ijkl = indices_temp[4]
1109                    count = indices_temp[5]
1110                    # start_concatenation = timer()
1111                    if indicesA is not None and count>0:
1112                        indicesA = np.concatenate([indicesA, indices_temp[0][0:count]])
1113                        indicesB = np.concatenate([indicesB, indices_temp[1][0:count]])
1114                        indicesC = np.concatenate([indicesC, indices_temp[2][0:count]])
1115                        indicesD = np.concatenate([indicesD, indices_temp[3][0:count]])
1116                    else:
1117                        
1118                        indicesA = indices_temp[0][0:count]
1119                        indicesB = indices_temp[1][0:count]
1120                        indicesC = indices_temp[2][0:count]
1121                        indicesD = indices_temp[3][0:count]
1122                    # duration_concatenation += timer() - start_concatenation
1123                    # Break out of the for loop if the nol. of significant triplets found is less than the chunksize 
1124                    # This is because, it means that there are no more significant triplets to be found from all possible configurations. 
1125                    if count<chunksize: 
1126                        break
1127                
1128                duration_indices_calc += timer() - start_indices_calc
1129                print('Time for significant indices evaluation: ', duration_indices_calc)
1130                # print('Time for array concatenation: ', duration_concatenation)
1131
1132                # Get rid of temp variables
1133                indices_temp=0
1134                ijk = 0
1135                
1136                print('Size of permanent array storing the significant indices of 4c2e ERI in GB ', indicesA.nbytes/1e9+indicesB.nbytes/1e9+indicesC.nbytes/1e9+indicesD.nbytes/1e9, flush=True)
1137
1138                nsignificant = len(indicesA)
1139                print('No. of elements in the standard four-centered two electron ERI tensor: ', nints4c2e, flush=True)
1140                print('No. of elements after factoring in the 8-fold symmetry in the four-centered two electron ERI tensor: ', nints4c2e_sym8, flush=True)
1141                print('No. of significant quadruplets based on Schwarz inequality and 8-fold symmetry: ' + str(nsignificant) + ' or '+str(np.round(nsignificant/nints4c2e*100,1)) + '% of original', flush=True)
1142                print('Schwarz screening done!')
1143                durationSchwarz = timer() - startSchwarz
1144                print('Total time taken for Schwarz screening '+str(durationSchwarz)+' seconds.\n', flush=True)

1384        if self.sao:
1385            #########
1386            # I use a trick to calculate the DFT energy in SAO basis. 
1387            # The trick is to get rid of the extra information in the CAO basis matrices.
1388            # The following does just that. 
1389            # Going from CAO --> SAO we lose the extra information then we go back to from SAO --> CAO
1390            # This way all the integrals (potential matrices and density matrices) can still be calculated
1391            # in the CAO basis. In fact even the KS matrix is diagonalized in the CAO basis with the extra information 
1392            # removed by forward and backward transformation: CAO --> SAO followed by SAO --> CAO.
1393            # This also helps in reducing the number of transformations needed for calculation of various energy contributions.
1394            #########
1395            # Convert the overlap matrix from CAO to SAO basis
1396            S = np.dot(c2sph_mat, np.dot(S, c2sph_mat.T)) # CAO --> SAO
1397            # Convert back to SAO so that now we lose the extra information that the CAO basis had

1402                # Removing the eigenvectors assoicated to the smallest eigenvalue.
1403                x = eig_vec_s[:,eig_val_s>1e-7] / np.sqrt(eig_val_s[eig_val_s>1e-7])
1404        else:

1519            KS = H + J + Vxc

1522                # This way even though the matrix dimensions would be that of CAO but the information would be the same as SAO

1544            if self.use_gpu:

1548                dmat_cp = dmat
1549                dmat = cp.asnumpy(dmat)
1550                streams[0].synchronize()
1551                cp.cuda.Stream.null.synchronize()
1552            else:
1553                with threadpool_limits(limits=ncores, user_api='blas'):
1554                    # print('KS eigh', controller.info())
1555                    eigvalues, eigvectors = self.solve(KS, S, orthogonalize=orthogonalize, x=x)
1556                mo_occ = self.getOcc(mol, eigvalues, eigvectors)
1557                dmat = self.gen_dm(eigvectors, mo_occ)
1558            durationKS = durationKS + timer() - startKS
1559
1560            # Check when to switch to double precision for XC
1561            if self.use_gpu:
1562                if precision_XC is cp.float32:
1563                    if abs(Etot_new-Etot)/abs(Etot_new)<5e-7:
1564                        precision_XC = cp.float64
1565                        print('\nSwitching to double precision for XC evaluation after '+str(itr) +' iterations!', flush=True)
1566                        
1567
1568
1569            durationItr = timer() - startIter
1570            print('\n\nTime taken for the previous iteration: '+str(durationItr)+'\n\n', flush=True)
1571
1572            # Check convergence criteria
1573            if abs(Etot_new-Etot)<conv_crit:
1574                scf_converged = True
1575                print('\nSCF Converged after '+str(itr) +' iterations!', flush=True)
1576                Etot = Etot_new
1577                print('\n-------------------------------------', flush=True)
1578                print('Total Energy = ', Etot, flush=True)
1579                print('-------------------------------------\n\n', flush=True)
1580                break
1581
1582            Etot = Etot_new
1583            itr = itr + 1
1584            
1585
1586        if itr>=max_itr and not scf_converged:
1587            print('\nSCF NOT Converged after '+str(itr-1) +' iterations!', flush=True)
1588
1589
1590        durationSCF = timer() - startSCF
1591        # print(dmat)
1592        print('\nTime taken : '+str(durationSCF) +' seconds.', flush=True)
1593        print('\n\n', flush=True)
1594        print('-------------------------------------', flush=True)
1595        print('Profiling', flush=True)
1596        print('-------------------------------------', flush=True)
1597        print('Preprocessing                          ', durationXCpreprocessing + durationAO_values + durationgrids_prune_rho + durationSchwarz)
1598        if isDF:
1599            print('Density Fitting                        ', durationDF, flush=True)
1600            if DF_algo==6 or DF_algo==10:
1601                print('    DF (gamma)                         ', durationDF_gamma, flush=True)
1602                print('    DF (coeff)                         ', durationDF_coeff, flush=True)
1603                print('    DF (Jtri)                          ', durationDF_Jtri, flush=True)
1604                if cholesky:
1605                    print('    DF (Cholesky)                      ', durationDF_cholesky, flush=True)
1606        print('DIIS                                   ', durationDIIS, flush=True)
1607        print('KS matrix diagonalization              ', durationKS, flush=True)
1608        print('One electron Integrals (S, T, Vnuc)    ', duration1e, flush=True)
1609        if isDF:
1610            print('Coulomb Integrals (2c2e + 3c2e)        ', durationCoulomb-durationSchwarz-durationDF_cholesky, flush=True)
1611        if not isDF:
1612            print('Coulomb Integrals (4c2e)               ', durationCoulomb-durationSchwarz, flush=True)
1613        print('Grids construction                     ', durationgrids, flush=True)
1614        print('Exchange-Correlation Term              ', durationxc, flush=True)
1615        totalTime = durationXCpreprocessing + durationAO_values + duration1e + durationCoulomb - durationDF_cholesky + \
1616            durationgrids + durationxc + durationDF + durationKS + durationDIIS + durationgrids_prune_rho 
1617        print('Misc.                                  ', durationSCF - totalTime, flush=True)
1618        print('Complete SCF                           ', durationSCF, flush=True)
1619
1620        if self.use_gpu:
1621            # Free memory of all GPUs
1622            for igpu in range(self.n_gpus):
1623                cp.cuda.Device(igpu).use()
1624                cp._default_memory_pool.free_all_blocks()
1625
1626            # Switch back to main GPU
1627            cp.cuda.Device(0).use()
1628        return Etot, dmat
1629

class DFT: 
  70class DFT:
  71    """
  72    A class for performing Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations 
  73    with optional support for density fitting (DF), GPU acceleration, and LibXC.
  74
  75    Parameters
  76    ----------
  77    mol : Molecule
  78        Molecular object on which the DFT calculation is to be performed.
  79    
  80    basis : Basis
  81        Orbital basis set used for the SCF calculation.
  82
  83    auxbasis : Basis, optional
  84        Auxiliary basis set for density fitting (DF). If None, a default will be assigned.
  85
  86    conv_crit : float, optional
  87        Convergence criterion for the SCF cycle in Hartrees (default is 1e-7).
  88
  89    dmat_guess_method : str, optional
  90        Method for the initial density matrix guess (e.g., 'core', 'huckel').
  91
  92    xc : list or str, optional
  93        Exchange-correlation functional specification. If None, defaults to LDA (`[1, 7]`).
  94
  95    grids : object, optional
  96        Precomputed numerical integration grids. If None, they will be generated automatically.
  97
  98    gridsLevel : int, optional
  99        Level of numerical integration grid refinement (default is 3).
 100
 101    blocksize : int, optional
 102        Block size for XC grid evaluations. Defaults depend on whether GPU is used.
 103
 104    save_ao_values : bool, optional
 105        If True, saves AO values to reuse during XC evaluation. Increases speed but uses more memory.
 106
 107    use_gpu : bool, optional
 108        Whether to use GPU acceleration.
 109
 110    ncores : int, optional
 111        Number of CPU cores to use (default is 2).
 112
 113    Attributes
 114    ----------
 115    dmat : ndarray
 116        Initial guess for the density matrix, will be computed during setup.
 117
 118    KSmats : list
 119        List of Kohn–Sham matrices used in DIIS extrapolation.
 120
 121    errVecs : list
 122        List of error vectors for DIIS.
 123
 124    max_itr : int
 125        Maximum number of SCF iterations (default is 50).
 126
 127    isDF : bool
 128        Whether to use density fitting for Coulomb integrals.
 129
 130    rys : bool
 131        Whether to use Rys quadrature for evaluating electron repulsion integrals.
 132
 133    DF_algo : int
 134        Algorithm selector for DF (reserved for developer use).
 135
 136    XC_algo : int
 137        Algorithm selector for XC evaluation (2 for CPU, 3 for GPU).
 138
 139    sortGrids : bool
 140        Whether to sort DFT integration grids (not recommended).
 141
 142    xc_bf_screen : bool
 143        Enable basis function screening for XC term evaluation.
 144
 145    threshold_schwarz : float
 146        Threshold for Schwarz screening (default is 1e-9).
 147
 148    strict_schwarz : bool
 149        If True, applies stricter Schwarz screening.
 150
 151    cholesky : bool
 152        If True, uses Cholesky decomposition for DF.
 153
 154    orthogonalize : bool
 155        If True, orthogonalizes AO basis functions.
 156
 157    sao : bool
 158        If True, uses SAO basis instead of CAO basis.
 159
 160    keep_ao_in_gpu : bool
 161        Whether to retain AO values in GPU memory during SCF (if `save_ao_values` is True).
 162
 163    use_libxc : bool
 164        Whether to use LibXC for XC functional evaluation (recommended off for GPU).
 165
 166    n_streams : int
 167        Number of CUDA streams to use (if applicable).
 168
 169    n_gpus : int
 170        Number of GPUs to use.
 171
 172    free_gpu_mem : bool
 173        Whether to forcibly free GPU memory after use.
 174
 175    max_threads_per_block : int
 176        Maximum threads per CUDA block supported by the device.
 177
 178    threads_x : int
 179        CUDA thread configuration (X dimension).
 180
 181    threads_y : int
 182        CUDA thread configuration (Y dimension).
 183
 184    dynamic_precision : bool
 185        Whether to use precision switching during XC evaluation for performance gains.
 186
 187    keep_ints3c2e_in_gpu : bool
 188        Whether to keep 3-center 2-electron integrals in GPU memory to avoid transfers.
 189
 190    debug : bool
 191        If True, prints debugging output during DFT calculations.
 192
 193    Notes
 194    -----
 195    - This class supports SCF DFT calculations with density fitting (DF).
 196    - GPU support is optional and provides significant speed-up for large systems.
 197    - The class is tightly integrated with PyFock and LibXC libraries.
 198
 199    Examples
 200    --------
 201    >>> mol = Molecule(...)
 202    >>> basis = Basis(mol, ...)
 203    >>> dft = DFT(mol, basis, xc='PBE', use_gpu=True)
 204    >>> dft.run_scf()
 205    """
 206    def __init__(self, mol, basis, auxbasis=None, conv_crit=1e-7, dmat_guess_method=None, 
 207                xc=None, grids=None, gridsLevel=3, blocksize=None, 
 208                save_ao_values=False, use_gpu=False, ncores=2): 
 209         
 210        self.mol = mol
 211        """ Molecular object for which the DFT calculation will be performed """
 212        if self.mol is None:
 213            print('ERROR: A Mol object is required to initialize a DFT object.')
 214        
 215        self.basis = basis
 216        """ Basis object for corresponding to the molecule for the DFT calculation """
 217        if self.basis is None:
 218            print('ERROR: A Basis object is required to initialize a DFT object.')
 219
 220        
 221        self.dmat_guess_method = dmat_guess_method
 222        """ Initial guess for the density matrix """
 223        if self.dmat_guess_method is None:
 224            self.dmat_guess_method = 'core'
 225
 226        self.dmat = None
 227        """ Initial density matrix guess for SCF """
 228        
 229        self.xc = xc
 230        """ Exchange-Correlation Functional """
 231        if self.xc is None: 
 232            self.xc = [1, 7] #LDA
 233            print("XC not specified, defaulting to LDA functional (LibXC codes: 1, 7)")
 234
 235        # DIIS
 236        self.KSmats = []
 237        self.errVecs = []
 238        self.diisSpace = 6
 239
 240        self.conv_crit = conv_crit
 241        """ Convergence criterion for SCF (in Hartrees) """
 242        # if self.conv_crit is None:
 243        #     self.conv_crit = 1.0E-7
 244
 245        self.max_itr = 50 
 246        """ Maximum number of iterations for SCF """
 247        # if self.max_itr is None:
 248        #     self.max_itr = 50
 249
 250        self.ncores = ncores
 251        """ Number of cores to be used for DFT calculation """
 252        if self.ncores is None:
 253            self.ncores = 2
 254
 255        self.grids = grids 
 256        """ Atomic grids for DFT calculation (If None or not supplied, will be generated using NumGrid) """
 257        self.gridsLevel = gridsLevel
 258        """ Atomic grids for DFT calculation """
 259
 260        self.isDF = True
 261        """ Use density fitting (DF) for two-electron Coulomb integrals. This is only for developers. Users should not change it. """
 262
 263        self.auxbasis = auxbasis
 264        """ Basis object to be used as the auxiliary basis for DF """
 265        if self.auxbasis is None:
 266            auxbasis = Basis(mol, {'all':Basis.load(mol=mol, basis_name='def2-universal-jfit')})
 267
 268        self.rys = True
 269        """ Use rys quadrature for the evaluation of two electron integrals (with and without DF)"""
 270
 271        self.DF_algo = 10
 272        """ This is only for developers. Users should not change it. """
 273
 274        self.blocksize = blocksize
 275        """ Block size for the evaulation of XC term on grids. For CPUs a value of ~5000 is recommended. For GPUs, a value >20480 is recommended. """
 276        if blocksize is None:
 277            if use_gpu:
 278                self.blocksize = 20480
 279            else:
 280                self.blocksize = 5000
 281        
 282        self.XC_algo = None
 283        """ This is only for developers. Users should not change it. The algorithm for XC evaluation should be 2 for CPU and 3 for GPU."""
 284        if use_gpu:
 285            self.XC_algo = 3
 286        else:
 287            self.XC_algo = 2 
 288
 289        self.debug = False
 290        """ Turn on printing debug statements """
 291        self.sortGrids = False
 292        """ Enable/Disable sorting of DFT grids. Doesn't seem to offer any signficant advantage."""
 293        self.save_ao_values = save_ao_values
 294        """ Whether to save atomic orbital (AO) values for reuse during XC evaluation. Improves performance but requires more memory. """
 295        self.xc_bf_screen = True
 296        """ Enable screening of basis functions for XC term evaluation to reduce computation time drastically. """
 297        self.threshold_schwarz = 1e-09
 298        """ Threshold for Schwarz screening of two-electron integrals. Smaller values increase accuracy but reduce sparsity. """
 299        self.strict_schwarz = True
 300        """ If True, enforce stricter Schwarz screening to aggressively eliminate small two-electron integrals. """
 301        self.cholesky = True
 302        """ Whether to use Cholesky decomposition for DF. Slightly speeds up calculations. """
 303        self.orthogonalize = True
 304        """ Apply orthogonalization to the AO basis. Should be True for most standard calculations. """
 305
 306
 307        # CAO or SAO
 308        self.sao = False
 309        """ Whether to use SAO basis or CAO basis. Default is CAO basis. """
 310
 311
 312        # GPU acceleration
 313        self.use_gpu = use_gpu
 314        """ Whether to use GPU acceleration or not """
 315        self.keep_ao_in_gpu = True
 316        """ Whether to keep the atomic orbitals for XC evaluation in GPU memory or CPU memory. Only relevant if save_ao_values = True. """
 317        self.use_libxc = True
 318        """ Whether to use LibXC's version of XC functionals or PyFock implementations. 
 319        Only relevant when GPU is used. For GPU calculations it is recommended to use PyFock 
 320        implementation as it avoids CPU-GPU transfers."""
 321        self.n_streams = 1
 322        self.n_gpus = 1
 323        """ Number of GPUs to be used """
 324        self.free_gpu_mem = False
 325        """ Whether the GPU memory should be freed by force or not"""
 326        try:
 327            self.max_threads_per_block = cuda.get_current_device().MAX_THREADS_PER_BLOCK
 328        except:
 329            self.max_threads_per_block = 1024
 330        
 331        self.threads_x = int(self.max_threads_per_block/16)
 332        self.threads_y = int(self.max_threads_per_block/64)
 333        self.dynamic_precision = False # Only for the XC term
 334        """ Whether to use dynamic precision switching for XC term or not """
 335        self.keep_ints3c2e_in_gpu = True
 336        """ Whether to keep the 3c2e integrals in GPU memory or not. 
 337        Recommended to keep in GPU memory to avoid CPU-GPU transfers at each iteration."""
 338
